Menengok Keindahan Wisata Pantai Plentong Indramayu
05 Nov 2019, 12:27 by Gelar Gandarasa
DESA Ujunggebang yang terletak di Kecamatan Sukra, Kabupaten Indramayu baru saja meraih penghargaan dari pemerintah daerah. Desa tersebut layak menjadi contoh untuk desa-desa lainnya supaya bisa berkembang ke depannya. Kepala Bidang Pemberdayaan Masyarakat dan Desa Dinas Pemberdayaan Masyarakat dan Desa Kabupaten Indramayu Ahmad Sulaeman mengatakan, Ujunggebang dipilih karena berhasil memberdayakan masyarakat di sekitarnya, khususnya dalam hal wisata pantai.
“Sukses karena penataan pantai Plentongnya,” kata Sulaeman, Senin 4 November 2019. Sulaeman mengatakan, prestasi Desa Ujunggebang merupakan contoh yang mesti ditiru oleh semua desa yang ada di Kabupaten Indramayu. Dengan pengelolaan administrasi dan keuangan yang baik bisa menjadikan suatu desa berkembang. Masyarakat di Desa Ujunggebang telah membuktikan bahwa kerja sama dan gotong royong bisa menghasilkan sesuatu yang bermanfaat bagi semua.
Wilayah pesisir Pantai Plentong di Desa Ujunggebang sejatinya tergerus abrasi sejak puluhan tahun lalu. Puluhan tahun lamanya masyarakat membiarkan begitu saja Pantai Plentong. Namun saat ini Plentong mulai menunjukkan pesonanya. Wilayah yang dahulu tak dilirik sama sekali kini menjadi andalan pendapatan bagi warga di Ujunggebang. Ada ratusan warga yang menggantungkan hidup dari keindahan alam yang ada di Plentong.
Kuwu Ujunggebang Kusnato hafal betul perkembangan Pantai Plentong mulai dari nol. “Waktu saya kecil itu di daerah yang sekarang laut, masih ada daratan,” ujar Kusnato. Sekitar 30 tahun lalu 7 kilometer dari posisi bibir pantai saat ini merupakan daratan. Daratan itu merupakan sebuah dusun yang dijadikan sebagai tempat berlangsungnya pemerintahan desa, perekonomian, dan kegiatan lain. Namun dusun bernama Plentong itu kini telah hilang akibat abrasi yang sangat parah. “Saya prihatin sekali melihat terus menyusutnya wilayah daratan di sini,” keluh dia.
Selain karena tak adanya upaya pencegahan abrasi, wilayah pesisir Plentong pun dahulu gundul. Tak ada tanaman apapun di bibir pantai sehingga ombak laut bisa dengan mudah menggerus pasir Pantai Plentong secara perlahan. Kesadaran akan kerusakan lingkungan pun baru muncul dari masyarakat beberapa tahun ke belakang ini.



Masyarakat mulai sadar menanami bibir Pantai Plentong dengan ribuan pohon mangrove. Pohon mangrove itu ditanami untuk mencegah abrasi di pantai tersebut. Hasilnya saat ini mulai terasa dengan berkurangnya secara signifikan abrasi di sana. “Kami bersama masyarakat desa melakukan penghijauan. Masyarakat juga secara swadaya membangun penahan abrasi di Plentong,” ungkap Kusnato.
Secara perlahan masyarakat pun mulai tergerak untuk membenahi lingkungan yang ada di sana. Dengan bantuan dari berbagai pihak, mereka mengubah wajah Plentong menjadi lebih indah dipandang. Sarana permainan dan fasilitas lainnya mulai dibangun. Hal itu mulai menarik pengunjung untuk berwisata ke Plentong. “Bukan dari Indramayu saja, bahkan kebanyakan pengunjung dari wilayah Subang. Ini mungkin karena letaknya yang dekat dengan perbatasan Indramayu-Subang,” tuturnya.
Kusnato mengatakan, kurang lebih 3.000 orang setiap minggunya datang berkunjung ke Plentong. Banyaknya pengunjung membuat perekonomian warga sekitar ikut terangkat. Betapa tidak, banyak warga yang membuka usaha atau terlibat mengelola Pantai Plentong. “Masyarakat ikut sejahtera dengan ramainya Pantai Plentong. Kami bersyukur wilayah ini bisa memberikan penghidupan bagi warga,” ucap dia.
Manfaat itu dirasakan sekali oleh warga. Salah seorang pedagang di Pantai Plentong Caskadi (39) mengaku, dahulu ia berprofesi sebagai nelayan. Namun kini ia beralih menjadi pedangan makanan di kawasan wisata Plentong karena lebih menjanjikan. Hasil yang didapat dari berdagang dinilai sudah lebih dari cukup untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya. “Alhamdulillah kalau lagi ramai pendapatan saya otomatis naik. Setiap harinya ada saja yang berkunjung ke sini walau tidak banyak. Tapi itu cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari,” katanya.***

Look at the Beauty of Plentong Beach Tourism Indramayu
05 Nov 2019, 12:27 by Title Axle
Ujunggebang DESA which is located in Sukra Subdistrict, Indramayu Regency has just won an award from the local government. The village is worthy of being an example for other villages to be able to develop in the future. Head of the Community and Village Empowerment Division of the Indramayu Regency Community and Village Empowerment Office Ahmad Sulaeman said, Ujunggebang was chosen because it succeeded in empowering the surrounding community, especially in terms of beach tourism.
"Success due to the arrangement of the Plentong beach," said Sulaeman, Monday, November 4, 2019. Sulaeman said, the achievements of the Ujunggebang Village were an example that must be emulated by all villages in the Indramayu Regency. With good administrative and financial management can make a village develop. The community in Ujunggebang Village has proven that cooperation and mutual cooperation can produce something that is beneficial to all.
The coastal area of Plentong Beach in Ujunggebang Village has actually been eroded since decades ago. Decades of people just let the Plentong Beach. But now Plentong is starting to show its charm. The area that was not previously glance at all is now a mainstay of income for residents in Ujunggebang. There are hundreds of people who depend on the natural beauty in Plentong.
Kuwu Ujunggebang Kusnato memorized the development of Plentong Beach from zero. "When I was a child in an area now sea, there was still land," Kusnato said. About 30 years ago 7 kilometers from the position of the shoreline is now the mainland. The land is a hamlet that is used as a place for village government, the economy and other activities. But the village named Plentong has now been lost due to severe abrasion. "I am very sorry to see continued shrinking land area here," he complained.
Apart from the absence of efforts to prevent abrasion, the coastal area of Plentong was once bare. There are no plants on the shoreline so the sea waves can easily erode the sand of Plentong Beach slowly. Awareness of environmental damage has only emerged from the community in recent years.



People are starting to realize planting the lips of Plentong Beach with thousands of mangrove trees. The mangrove tree was planted to prevent abrasion on the beach. The results are now beginning to be felt with a significant reduction in abrasion there. "We, together with the village community, are going green. The community also independently built an abrasion barrier in Plentong, "Kusnato said.
Gradually the community began to be moved to fix the environment there. With the help of various parties, they changed the face of Plentong to be more beautiful to look at. Game facilities and other facilities began to be built. It began to attract visitors to travel to Plentong. "Not just from Indramayu, even most visitors from the Subang region. This is probably because it is located close to the Indramayu-Subang border, "he said.
Kusnato said, approximately 3,000 people every week come to visit Plentong. The large number of visitors has raised the economy of local residents. Imagine, many residents open businesses or are involved in managing Plentong Beach. "The community is prosperous with the crowd of Plentong Beach. We are grateful that this region can provide livelihoods for residents, "he said.
The benefits were felt by the residents. One trader in Plentong Beach Caskadi (39) claimed that he used to work as a fisherman. But now he has turned into food traders in the tourist area of Plentong because it is more promising. The results obtained from trading are considered to be more than enough to send their children to school. "Alhamdulillah, when I'm busy my income will automatically go up. Every day there are people who visit here, although not many. But it is enough to meet the needs of daily life, "he said. ***
